channel.title: Restless Legs on VitaminDWiki
channel.description: Recent content in Restless Legs on VitaminDWiki

item.title: Leg cramps in pregnant women not changed by 1,000 IU of vitamin D for 6 weeks (no surprise) – RCT
item.description:
The effect of Vitamin D and calcium plus Vitamin D on leg cramps in pregnant women: A randomized controlled trial

{http://jrms.mui.ac.ir/index.php/jrms/article/view/10603 |Journal of Research in Medical Science]

Ameneh Mansouri, Mojgan Mirghafourvand, Sakineh Mohammad Alizadeh Charandabi, Moslem Najafi

It is very unlikely that only 1,000 IU for only 6 weeks could improve any condition

It is an interesting idea however.

See also VitaminDWiki

  • Restless Legs Syndrome - Vitamin D, Iron, etc. - many studies

item.title: DNA and VDR tests - 100 to 200 dollars
item.description:
• Many DNA gene testing services (most only provide ancestry info.)
    • VDR tests the gene you were born with, not it’s activation
      • Vitamin D Receptor test $119
      • Vitamin D Receptor test $86 + ship to Greece
      • Varous companies can post-analyze DNA tests (such as 23andMe) to discover VDR, etc.
      • VDR test : muscle mass and bone strength (Dec 2016)

Many DNA gene testing services (most only provide ancestry info.)

  • 3 Essential Tips You Must Know Before Buying a DNA Test

item.title: Dopamine increased with vitamin D supplementation (in rats)
item.description:
The Vitamin D Content of a High-Fat Diet Modulates Brain Reward Neurochemistry

The FASEB Journal, vol. 30 no. 1 Supplement lb202 , April 2016

Ruslan Kubant1, Diptendu Chatterjee1, Emanuela Pannia1 and G. Harvey Anderson1,2

1Nutritional Sciences, University of Toronto, Toronto, ON, Canada

2Physiology, University of Toronto, Toronto, ON, Canada

Rats on high fat diet (60% of calories)

Age 3 weeks to 17 weeks

Compare 7,000 IU vs 1000 IU of Vitamin D per kilogram of feed

item.title: Restless legs syndrome 3X more likely during pregnancy (low vitamin D)
item.description:
Restless legs syndrome and pregnancy:

prevalence, possible pathophysiological mechanisms and treatment

Acta Neurologica Scandinavica, online 19 OCT 2015, DOI: 10.1111/ane.12520

R. Gupta 1, M. Dhyani 1, T. Kendzerska 2, S. R. Pandi-Perumal 3, A. S. BaHammam 4,5, P. Srivanitchapoom 6,7, S. Pandey 8 and M. Hallett 6

Restless legs syndrome (RLS) is a common sleep disorder that may be associated with pregnancy. Studies have found that the prevalence of RLS among pregnant women ranged from 10 to 34%. Typically, there is complete remission of symptoms soon after parturition; however, in some patients, they may continue postpartum.

item.title: Magnesium – I used to believe that food had enough, now I supplement with 400 mg daily – Dr. Lundberg
item.description:
See also Web

  • Magnesium in the Diet: The Bad News about Magnesium Food Sources

“Magnesium content in vegetables has seen declines from 25-80% since pre-1950 figures,…”

“The average American diet contains barely over 50% of the conservative US recommended daily allowance (RDA) for magnesium, and roughly three quarters of the population consumes a magnesium insufficient diet”

“Absorption rates can vary, and according to studies can sometimes be as low as 20%”

item.title: Overlap between Fibromyalgia and other Chronic Pains – 2012
item.description:
The Prevalence of Fibromyalgia in Other Chronic Pain Conditions

Hindawi Publishing Corporation Pain Research and Treatment Volume 2012, Article ID 584573, 8 pages doi:10.1155/2012/584573

Muhammad B. Yunus yunus@uic.edu

Section of Rheumatology, Department of Medicine, University of Illinois College of Medicine at Peoria, One Mini Drive, Peoria, IL 61605, USA

FMS and Central Sensitivity Syndrome

Disease and prevalence of FMS

Central sensitivity syndromes (CSS) include fibromyalgia syndrome (FMS), irritable bowel syndrome, temporomandibular disorder, restless legs syndrome, chronic fatigue syndrome, and other similar chronic painful conditions that are based on central sensitization (CS). CSS are mutually associated. In this paper, prevalence of FMS among other members of CSS has been described. An important recent recognition is an increased prevalence of FMS in other chronic pain conditions with structural pathology, for example, rheumatoid arthritis, systemic lupus, ankylosing spondylitis, osteoarthritis, diabetes mellitus, and inflammatory bowel disease. Diagnosis and proper management of FMS among these diseases are of crucial importance so that unwarranted use of such medications as corticosteroids can be avoided, since FMS often occurs when RA or SLE is relatively mild.

item.title: Growing pains reduced 60 percent by monthly Vitamin D
item.description:
Significant association among growing pains, vitamin D supplementation, and bone mineral status: results from a pilot cohort study.

J Bone Miner Metab. 2014 Mar 15. [Epub ahead of print]

Morandi G1 grazia.morandi@gmail.com, Maines E, Piona C, Monti E, Sandri M, Gaudino R, Boner A, Antoniazzi F.

Initial growing pain level 7.5

Vitamin D supplementation for 3 months

Vitamin D levels increased to 34 ng (an OK level)

Growing pain level dropped to 2.7

item.title: Restless Legs Syndrome and ADHD strongly associated (no mention of vitamin D) – 2005
item.description:
Restless legs syndrome and attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder: a review of the literature.

Sleep. 2005 Aug 1;28(8):1007-13.

Cortese S1, Konofal E, Lecendreux M, Arnulf I, Mouren MC, Darra F, Dalla Bernardina B.

STUDY OBJECTIVE:

To review evidence on the association between restless legs syndrome (RLS) and attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), to discuss the hypothetical mechanisms underlying this association, and to consider the potential interest for common pharmacologic treatments of RLS and ADHD when co-occurring.

item.title: Restless Legs Syndrome - Vitamin D, Iron, etc. - many studies
item.description:
RLS has been separately treated by Iron, Magnesium. and Vitamins

      • RLS review by Perplexity AI Jan 2025
      • RLS: genes and glutamate - meta-analysis June 2024
      • Vitamin D and Restless Legs Syndrome: A Review of Current Literature - April 2023
      • RLS associated with low vitamin D, The more severe the RLS, the lower the D - Dec 2021
      • RLS treated by weekly 50,000 IU of vitamin D - Feb 2020
      • RLS 3 X more likely if < 20 ng/mL of Vitamin D (8X if a teacher) – March 2018
      • RLS associated with many other Vitamin D Deficiency diseases - July 2017
      • Restless legs syndrome associated with (a few) major diseases -A systematic review and new concept - April 2016
      • RLS score dropped from 26 to 10 after Vitamin D levels were raised to just 25 ng - Aug 2014
      • Restless Legs Syndrome 5X more likely if vitamin D deficient - May 2014
      • Sleep Apnea solutions may apply also to RLS (Vitamins D and B, good gut)
      • RLS triggers - Oct 2018
      • RLS not treated by weekly 50,000 IU of vitamin D, but was treated by placebo - RCT Nov 2018
      • RLS increased risk of Vascular Dementia 1.8X (suspect low D or Mg) - March 2023

RLS review by Perplexity AI Jan 2025

Restless Legs Syndrome appears to be treated by at least Vitamin D, Vitamin K, Iron and Magnesium.
Are there others? Which is best? Is there some combination which is best?

item.title: Restless legs and growing pains may be both due to low vitamin D
item.description:
Restless legs syndrome (Willis-Ekbom disease) and growing pains: are they the same thing?

A side-by-side comparison of the diagnostic criteria for both and recommendations for future research

Sleep Medicine

Arthur S. Walters a, Arthur.Walters@Vanderbilt.edu; David Gabelia b, Birgit Frauscher b

a Department of Neurology, Sleep Division, Vanderbilt University School of Medicine, Nashville, Tennessee, USA

b Department of Neurology, Innsbruck Medical University, Innsbruck, Austria

There has been no previous side-by-side comparison of the diagnostic criteria for restless legs syndrome (RLS)(Willis-Ekbom disease) and growing pains. In our review, we explore this comparison emphasizing overlaps and disconnects, summarize recent literature exploring the relationship between the 2 entities, and make suggestions for future research.

item.title: Iron deficiency is a cause of Vitamin D deficiency
item.description:
• IRON Summary
      • Heme iron polypeptide (HIP) - appears to be the best form
      • See also VitaminDWiki
      • Bidirectional Relationship Between Iron and Vitamin D - Perplexity AI April 2025
      • See also web
      • Hypothesis of interactions between Iron and Vitamin C - 2016
      • Vegetarians and vegans have less vitamin D in blood: Less Iron?
    • Iron Deficiency material follows
      • Iron Deficiency Guide has the following venn diagram
      • What Is Iron-Deficiency Anemia? NIH
      • Iron Therapy Organization online textbook: contents
      • Decreasing Iron in the blood (US CDC 2002)
    • Iron Deficiency anemia
      • Iron-Deficiency Anemia - How to Get the Most Iron Out of Your Diet and Supplements EZIneArticles July 2012
      • Iron Deficiency and Anemia, Causes, Consequences, and Solutions Excellent
      • Anemia varies with age and sex
      • Effects of Iron on Vitamin D Metabolism: A Systematic Review - Dec 2016

IRON Summary

  • Human body needs Iron, especially the liver, which also processes Vitamin D
